title: Atomic Scale Defect Formation and Evolution at LiGa5O8/β-Ga2O3 and Ga2O3/Ni/Au Interfaces
content: Beta gallium oxide (β-Ga2O3) is a promising candidate for future power electronics due to its distinctive advantages such as ultrawide bandgap [1], high breakdown voltage [2], and tunable n-type doping [3]. We use scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) combined with spectroscopy methods to understand the unique structure-property relationships in Ga2O3 materials and interfaces. Our recent studies for two novel interfaces of Ga2O3 will be presented.
